Class GraphAdjacentList<K extends Comparable<K>,V>

java.lang.Object
com.example.romeandvikings.structures.Graph<K,V>

All Implemented Interfaces:
IGraph<K,V>
public class GraphAdjacentList<K extends Comparable<K>,V> extends Graph<K,V>
The GraphAdjacentList class is a Java implementation of a graph data structure using an adjacency list representation.

    • shortestPath

      public ArrayList<Integer> shortestPath(K startNode, K endNode) throws exceptionNoVertexExist
      The function calculates the shortest path between two nodes in a graph using Dijkstra's algorithm and returns the path as a list of integers.
      Parameters:
      startNode - The startNode parameter is the starting node of the shortest path. It represents the node from which the shortest path will be calculated.
      endNode - The endNode parameter represents the node in the graph where the shortest path ends.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an ArrayList of Integers, which represents the shortest path from the startNode to the endNode.

      exceptionNoVertexExist
